intro: Bicornella debilis, commonly known as the slender bicornell, is a delicate annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Bicornella debilis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its fragility, it is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats.
